cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Every hour of every day, I've imagined a new way to lose you. And only one to keep you.”
—Llyr, to Nyneve[/i]

cards.rules_text: When Skittering Hag enters the battlefield, until end of turn, up to one target creature has base power and toughness 1/1 and up to one other target creature has base power and toughness 4/4.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Bug. Bug. Stupid little bug. If only you were bigger, your belly would be so snug.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Whenever an enchantment spell you control resolves, draw a card and create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with lifelink.
Whenever an Omen spell you control resolves, draw a card and create a 1/1 black Spirit creature token with deathtouch and “This creature can't block.”

{R}{W}: Forswear. [i](Put a +1/+1 counter on this and up to one other creature. That creature gains the following abilities until end of turn and this is no longer Human. Activate only once.)[/i]
At the beginning of combat on your turn, create a 2/2 green Hound creature token with haste and lifelink.

Each opponent's maximum hand size is equal to the number of cards in your hand.
When you have no cards in hand, you draw a card and you lose 2 life.

Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, they sacrifice a noncreature, nonbasic permanent. If they do, they may search their library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.

cards.flavor_text: [i]A century past, by the guidance of the Lady, the grail was found. The Immortal Table was born. Death was beaten. And no one would be saved.[/i]

cards.rules_text:

cards.rules_text:
Indestructible

cards.flavor_text: [i]“Wisdom comes not from age, I believe, but from the settling of death. These knights were young in both body and soul a century past, and they are young still.”[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Llyr didn't dare blink, for she could think of no greater horror than being parted from those eyes.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]“A hundred years of immortality, and the shadows yet grow longer. Does the Table offer failure alone, or may you at last bring ruin upon our enemies?”[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]First was Amity, her peerless swordsmanship no defense against a spelled arrow. Verity and Justice were found after the battle, back to back, surrounded by a dozen knights. And last was Hope, on the funeral pyre for her fallen friends.[/i]
